authors.name: Technical  Outreach and Assistance for States Team
authors.affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5oqs3","text":"This protocol provides instructions on how to run the DRAGON COVID Lineage app on the Illumina BaseSpace Sequence Hub. The DRAGON COVID Lineage app reads in fastq sequence files and produces Lineage, Clade, and Kmer Detection reports for each run. The information provided in these reports include Pangolin lineage classification, variant calls, and the fraction of human and SARS-CoV-2 kmers detected. The DRAGON COVID Lineage app also assembles a consensus sequence fasta file for each sample. This document applies to all whole-genome sequencing runs on the Illumina platform and downstream bioinformatics for public health laboratories.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s9se","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe48s","text":"For technical assistance, please contact: TOAST@cdc.gov","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

The protocol content here is under development and is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal, medical, clinical, or safety advice, or otherwise; content added to protocols.io is not peer reviewed and may not have undergone a formal approval of any kind. Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":363,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":834,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"79780FFA2DEB11EC9FDA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"79780F922DEB11EC9FDA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hk6g","text":"Add Fastq files to the new project directory. This can be done by either uploading fastq files from a local directory or by importing sequences using their Sequence Read Archive (SRA) accession numbers from NCBI using the ‘SRA Import’ app.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b287j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e87d4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agieo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vj7k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12ic7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9nqd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"49sid","text":"The step case format does not translate well in a pdf file. cases.title: Upload Fastq files from local directory
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d4ghu","text":"Go to FILE  --> UPLOAD --> FILES and it will bring you to the ‘Upload Files’ page","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpo0t","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"11jrq","text":"Click on the FASTQ tile and add the selected fastq files for upload. It should be noted that BaseSpace has specific upload requirements for fastq files including file naming schemes and header formats.
